metadata.title: CVE-2019-5059 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the XPM image rendering functionality of SDL2_image 2.0.4. A specially crafted XPM image can cause an integer overflow, allocating too small of a buffer. This buffer can then be written out of bounds resulting in a heap overflow, ultimately ending in code execution. An attacker can display a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-1').
